title: RSC  Live The Merchant of Venice (2016)  w ENG subs
description:
Royal Shakespeare Company The Merchant of Venice (2016)
by William Shakespeare from Opus Arte Productions
presented live at Stratford Upon Avon

Includes English only subtitles

Runtime 138 mins  One file

Extra features (13 min.): Telling the story; Setting the stage; 

Cast and creatives

Directed for the stage by Polly Findlay
Directed for the screen by Robin Lough

Portia             Patsy Ferran       
Antonio            James Ballard
Bassanio           Jacob Fortune Lloyd
Nerisa             Nadia Albina
Shylock            Makram J. Khoury
Lancelot Gobbo     Tim Samuels

Full cast and crew in the credits

Summary from Wikipedia

"Bassanio, a young Venetian of noble rank, wishes to woo the beautiful and 
wealthy heiress Portia of Belmont. Having squandered his estate, he needs 3,000 
ducats to subsidise his expenditures as a suitor. Bassanio approaches his friend 
Antonio, a wealthy merchant of Venice who has previously and repeatedly bailed 
him out. Antonio agrees, but since he is cash-poor â€“ his ships and merchandise 
are busy at sea â€“ he promises to cover a bond if Bassanio can find a lender, so 
Bassanio turns to the Jewish moneylender Shylock and names Antonio as the loan's 
guarantor."

My notes

  Included here are the dvd features provided with the disk for this production.  
Casting is a particular point of interest.  Makram Khoury is interviewed and is a 
Palestinian from Israel.  The set for the RSC is also  profiled in a separate 
featurette.

 For those who want to follow this play with English subtitles, the VOB subs are 
selectable from the menu in your VLC player.

  In the my collection at TPB  is another Merchant of Venice.  That one is set in 
Pre-War Nazi Germany directed by Trevor Nunn.  Both productions have  highlights 
that make them exceptional.  Watch for the cabaret song in the Trevor Nunn 
production.  

  As always, these encodes are a way for those interested to get them for their 
libraries that others may enjoy them
